comments: Write any 8-bit value to this register to reset the mixer chip. After a reset, all the registers will be restored to their default values.

(OPL3-SAx)
Bits 7-5: Voice volume L
Bits 3-1: Voice volume R

The actual value written is translated according to a table with the Master volume to update the actual chipset volume. Reading the register will only return what was written, not the actual state of the hardware mixer

(OPL3-SAx)
Bits 2-1: Mic volume

Mic volume can be read and written but has no effect

Bit 5: Input Filter
Bit 3: Low-Pass Filter
Bits 2-1: Input Source

The contents of this register can be read and written but have no effect

Bit 5: Output Filter
Output filter off switch.
0 ⇒ Output filter on, output through low-pass filter.
1 ⇒ Output filter off, bypass the low-pass filter
Default is 0 ⇒ Output filter on.

Bit 1: Stereo Switch
Digitized sound data stereo output switch.
This must be switched back to default as soon as stereo output is done.
0 ⇒ mono output.
1 ⇒ stereo output.
Default is 0 ⇒ mono output.

Turn off the filter for high sampling rates or stereo output.

(OPL3-SAx)
Bits 7-5: Master volume L
Bits 3-1: Master volume R

The actual value written is translated according to a table with the Master volume to update the actual chipset volume. Reading the register will only return what was written, not the actual state of the hardware mixer
